DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immunology Autoimmune Disease Family Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system._A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them._Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.:Text; the words of something written.
